monogr.title: An abridgement of all sea-lavves : Gathered forth of all writings and monuments, which are to be found among any people or nation, upon the coasts of the great Ocean and Mediterranean Sea. And specially ordered and disposed for the use and benefit of all benevolent sea-farers, within his Majesties dominions of Great Brittain, Ireland, and the adjacent isles thereof. By William Welvvod, professor of the civill lawe
monogr.author: Welwood, William

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: TO THE HIGH AND mighty Prince, Iames, King of Great Brittaine, France and Ireland, &c.
div.p:
IT pleased your M. some yeers past, most graciously to accept of this birth, in the great weakenesse and in fancie thereof. Therefore
is it, that now being strong, and by all warrants inarmed, it most thankefully returnes, offering service to your M. even for all the coasts of your Highnesse dominions, upon hope to merit your former grace.

closer.signed: Your M. most humble subject, and daily orator, W. Welwod.
